column1: 最后我们被关了起来，写了很长时间的交待材料。
column2: Finally we were taken into custody and forced to write confessions for a long time.

column1: 起初我是这么写的：我和陈清扬有不正当的关系。
column2: At first I wrote the following: Chen Qingyang and I have an indecent relationship.

column1: 这就是全部。
column2: That was all.

column1: 上面说，这样写太简单， 叫我重写。
column2: But it came down from above that what I wrote was too simple, and they asked me to start over.

column1: 后来我写，我和陈清扬有不正当关系，我干了她很多回，她也乐意让我干。
column2: Later on I wrote that Chen Qingyang and I had an indecent relationship, and that I had screwed her many times, and she liked being screwed by me.

column1: 上面说，这样写缺少细节。
column2: This time the opinions from above said it needed more detail.

column1: 后来又加上了这样的细节：我们俩第四十次非法性交，地点是我在山上偷盖的草房。
column2: So I added detail: The fortieth time that we made illegal love, the location was the thatched hut I secretly built on the mountain.

column1: 那天不是阴历十五就是阴历十六，反正月亮很亮。
column2: It was either the fifteenth or the sixteenth by the lunar calendar—whatever the date, the moon shone brightly.

column1: 陈清扬坐在竹床上，月光从门里照进来，照在她身上。
column2: Chen Qingyang sat on the bamboo bed, her body gleaming in the moonlight that shone through the door.

column1: 我站在地上，她用腿圈着我的腰。
column2: I stood on the ground, and she locked her legs around my waist.

column1: 我们还聊了几句，我说她的乳房不但圆，而且长的很端正，脐窝不但圆，而且很浅。
column2: We chatted for a while. I told her that her breasts were not just full, but also shapely; her navel not only round, but shallow too.

column1: 这些都很好。
column2: All of this was very good.

column1: 她说是吗，我自己不知道。
column2: She said, Really? I had no idea.

column1: 后来月光移走了，我点了一根烟，抽到一半她拿走了，接着吸了几口。
column2: After a while the moonlight moved away. I lit a cigarette, but she took it from me after I finished half of it, taking several drags.

column1: 她还捏过我的鼻子，因为本地有一种说法，说童男的鼻子很硬，而纵欲过度行将死去的人鼻子很软。
column2: She pinched my nose, for the locals believed that a virgin's nose would be very hard, and a man dying of too much sex would have a soft nose.

column1: 这些时候她懒懒地躺在床上，倚着竹板墙。 其它的时间她像澳大利亚考拉熊一样抱住我，往我脸上吹热气。
column2: On some of these occasions she lazed on the bed, leaning against the bamboo wall; other times she held me like a koala bear, blowing warm breath on my face.

column1: 最后月亮从门对面的窗子里照进来。 这时我和她分开。
column2: At last the moonlight shone through the window opposite the door and we were separate by then.

column1: 但是我写这些材料，不是给军代表看。 他那时早就不是军代表了，而且已经复员回家去。
column2: However, I wrote these confessions not for the military deputy — he was no longer our military deputy, having been discharged from the army and gone back home.

column1: 他是不是代表不重要，反正犯了我们这种错误，总是要写交待材料。
column2: It didn't matter whether he was our military deputy or not, we had to write confessions about our errors anyway.

column1: 我后来和我们学校人事科长关系不错。
column2: Years later, I had a good relationship with the director of personnel at our school.

column1: 他说当人事干部最大的好处就是可以看到别人写的交待材料。 我想他说的包括了我写的交待材料。
column2: He told me that the great thing about the job was that you could read other people's confessions, which I believe included mine.

column1: 我以为我的交待材料最有文彩。
column2: I thought of all the confessions mine would be the richest and most vivid.

column1: 因为我写这些材料时住在招待所，没有别的事可干，就像专业作家一样。
column2: That was because I wrote it in a hotel, with nothing else to do, like a professional writer.

column1: 我逃跑是晚上的事。
column2: In the evening I made my escape.

column1: 那天上午，我找司务长请假，要到井坎镇买牙膏。
column2: That morning, I asked the mess officer for a day off because I needed to go to Jingkan to buy toothpaste.

column1: 我归司务长领导，他还有监视我的任务。
column2: I worked under the mess officer, who also had the task of watching me.

column1: 他应该随时随地看住我，可是天一黑我就不见了。
column2: He was supposed to keep an eye on me every minute, but I disappeared as soon as it got dark.

column1: 早上我带给他很多酸琶果，都是好的。
column2: In the morning I brought him a lot of loquats, all very good.

column1: 平原上的酸琶果都不能吃，因为里面是一窝蚂蚁。
column2: The loquats growing on the plain aren't edible, because of the ant colonies in them.

column1: 只有山里的酸琶果才没蚂蚁。
column2: Only the ones on the mountain don't have ants.

column1: 司务长说，他个人和我关系不坏，而且军代表不在。 他可以准我去买牙膏。
column2: The mess officer said since we got along, and the military deputy wasn't around, he'd allow me to go buy toothpaste.

column1: 但是司务长又说，军代表随时会回来。
column2: But he also said the military deputy might return any minute.

column1: 要是他回来时我不在，司务长也不能包庇我。
column2: If I were not here by the time the military deputy returned, he couldn't cover for me.

column1: 我从队里出去，爬上十五队的后山，拿个镜片晃陈清扬的后窗。
column2: I left my team and climbed to the fifteenth team's mountainside, holding a small piece of mirror to reflect light on Chen Qingyang's back window.

column1: 过一会儿，她到山上来，说是头两天人家把她盯得特紧，跑不出来。
column2: After a while, she came up the mountain and told me that since people had been keeping a close eye on her for the past two days, she hadn't been able to get out.

column1: 而这几天她又来月经。
column2: And right now she was having her period.

column1: 她说这没关系，干吧。
column2: She said that shouldn't be a problem and we could still do it.

column1: 我说那不行。
column2: I said that wasn't going to work.

column1: 分手时她硬要给我二百块钱。
column2: When we said goodbye to each other, she insisted on giving me two hundred yuan.

column1: 起初我不要，后来还是收下了。
column2: I refused at first, but then took it after a while.

column1: 后来陈清扬告诉我，头两天人家没有把她盯得特紧，后来她也没有来月经。
column2: Later Chen Qingyang told me that nobody had been keeping a close eye on her those two days, and she hadn't been having her period when she saw me.

column1: 事实上，十五队的人根本就不管她。
column2: In fact, people in the fifteenth team didn't pay attention to her at all.

column1: 那里的人习惯于把一切不是破鞋的人说成破鞋，而对真的破鞋放任自流。
column2: People there were used to accusing the innocent of being damaged goods, but as for real damaged goods, they just let them do whatever they wanted.

column1: 她之所以不肯上山来，让我空等了好几天，是因为对此事感到厌倦。
column2: The reason that she didn't come up the mountain and kept me waiting for nothing was because she began to feel tired of it.

column1: 她总要等有了好心情才肯性交，不是只要性交就有好心情。
column2: She couldn't do it unless she was in the right mood; having sex wouldn't necessarily put her in a good mood.

column1: 当然这样做了以后，她也不无内疚之心。
column2: Of course, after her deception she felt guilty.

column1: 所以她给我二百块钱。
column2: That was why she gave me two hundred yuan.

column1: 我想既然她有二百块钱花不掉，我就替她花。
column2: I thought since she might have trouble spending the two hundred yuan, I wouldn't mind helping her.

column1: 所以我拿了那些钱到井坎镇上，买了一条双筒猎枪。
column2: So I brought the money with me to Jingkan and bought a double-barreled shotgun for myself.

column1: 后来我写交待材料，双筒猎枪也是一个主题。
column2: Later when I wrote my confessions, the double-barreled shotgun was also an issue.

column1: 人家怀疑我拿了它要打死谁。
column2: They suspected that I might want to kill someone with it.

column1: 其实要打死人，用二百块钱的双筒猎枪和四十块钱的铜炮枪打都一样。
column2: Actually, if I'd wanted to kill someone, it wouldn't have made any difference whether I used a two hundred-yuan double-barreled shotgun or a forty-yuan bronze-barreled gun.

column1: 那种枪是用来在水边打野鸭子的，在山里一点不实用，而且像死人一样沉。
column2: A bronze-barreled gun, normally used to shoot wild ducks by the water, was not practical at all in the mountains; besides, it was as heavy as a corpse.

column1: 那天我到井坎街上时，已经是下午时分，又不是赶街的日子，所以只有一条空空落落的土路和几间空空落落的国营商店。
column2: When I got to the street in Jingkan that day, it was already afternoon, and since it wasn't a market day, there was just a deserted dirt road and a few deserted state-run stores.

column1: 商店里有一个售货员在打瞌睡，还有很多苍蝇在飞。
column2: Inside one store a saleswoman dozed while a swarm of flies circled around.

column1: 货架上写着“吕过吕乎”，放着铝锅铝壶。
column2: The shelf display read "aloomenum wokk" and "aloomenum kittel," and underneath were aluminum woks and aluminum kettles.

column1: 我和那个胶东籍的售货员聊了一会天，她叫我到库房里看了看。
column2: I chatted awhile with the saleswoman, who was from Shandong Province, and she let me go in their storeroom to look around myself.

column1: 在那儿我看见那条上海出的猎枪，就不顾它已经放了两年没卖出去的事实，把它买下了。
column2: In there I saw a shotgun made in Shanghai. So I bought it even though it had sat there for nearly two years.

column1: 傍晚时我拿它到小河边试放，打死了一只鹭鸶。
column2: At dusk I tested it on the riverbank and killed a heron.

column1: 这时军代表从场部回来，看见我手里有枪，很吃了一惊。
column2: The military deputy happened to return from the farm headquarters right then and was shocked to see my shotgun.

column1: 他唠叨说，这件事很不对，不能什么人手里都有枪。 应该和队里说一下，把王二的枪没收掉。
column2: He went on about how it was not right that everyone could have a gun, and that someone had to talk to the team leader and confiscate Wang Er's gun.

column1: 我听了这话，几乎要朝他肚子上打一枪。
column2: When I heard this, I felt the urge to fire at his belly.

column1: 如果打了的话，恐怕会把他打死。
column2: If I had, it would probably have killed him.

column1: 那样多半我也活不到现在了。
column2: Then most likely I wouldn't be around today.

column1: 那天下午我从井坎回队的路上，涉水从田里经过，曾经在稻棵里站了一会。
column2: On the way back from Jingkan that afternoon, I waded through the paddy field and stood among the rice seedlings for a while.

column1: 我看见很多蚂蝗像鱼一样游出来，叮上了我的腿。
column2: I saw leeches swimming out like fish and sticking to my legs.

column1: 那时我光着膀子，衣服包了很多红糖馅的包子（镇上饭馆只卖这一种食品），双手提包子，背上还背了枪，很累赘。
column2: I was naked to the waist then, because I had used my clothes to wrap brown sugar buns (the only kind of food sold in the town's restaurant), and with the buns in my hands and a gun slung over my back, I felt really loaded down.

column1: 所以我也没管那些蚂蝗。
column2: So I ignored the leeches.

column1: 到了岸上我才把它们一条条揪下来用火烧死。
column2: Only when I got up the bank did I start pulling them off one by one and burning them.

column1: 烧得它们一条条发软起泡。
column2: They turned soft and blistery in the fire.

column1: 忽然间我感到很烦很累，不像二十一岁的人。
column2: All of a sudden, I felt very frustrated and tired, nothing like a twenty-one-year-old.

column1: 我想，这样下去很快就会老了。
column2: I realized I would get old quickly if things continued like this.

column1: 后来我遇上了勒都。 他告诉我说，他们把那条河岔里的鱼都捉到手了。
column2: After a while, I ran into Le Du, who told me that they had caught all the fish at the fork of the rivers.

column1: 我那一份已经晒成了鱼干，在他姐姐手里。
column2: My share had been dried into stockfish and stored at his sister's place.

column1: 他姐姐叫我去。
column2: His sister wanted me to come get it.

column1: 他姐姐和我也很熟，是个微黑俏丽的小姑娘。
column2: I knew his sister very well; she was a dark, pretty girl.

column1: 我说一时去不了。
column2: I told him that I couldn't get there for a while.

column1: 我把那一包包子都给了勒都，叫他给我到十五队送个信，告诉陈清扬，我用她给我的钱买了一条枪。
column2: I gave him all my brown sugar buns and asked him to take a message to the fifteenth team, telling Chen Qingyang that I'd bought a gun with her money.

column1: 勒都去了十五队，把这话告诉陈清扬，她听了很害怕，觉得我会把军代表打死。
column2: Le Du went to the fifteenth team and told Chen Qingyang. She was afraid that I might shoot the military deputy.

column1: 这种想法也不是没有道理，傍晚时我就想打军代表一枪。
column2: This concern was not completely unreasonable. By the evening I really began to consider taking a shot at the military deputy.

column1: 傍晚时分我在河边打鹭鸶，碰上了军代表。
column2: At dusk, when I shot the heron by the river, I ran into the military deputy.

column1: 像往常一样，我一声不吭，他喋喋不休。
column2: As usual, I stayed mute and he kept nagging at me.

column1: 我很愤怒，因为已经有半个多月了，他一直对我喋喋不休，说着同样的话：我很坏，需要思想改造。
column2: I got really angry. For more than two weeks, he had been holding forth on the same subject over and over, that I was a bad person and needed thought reform.

column1: 对我一刻也不能放松。
column2: People shouldn't let up on me for a minute.

column1: 这样的话我听了一辈子，从来没有像那天晚上那么火。
column2: I'd been hearing that sort of thing all my life but never got angrier than that night.

column1: 后来他又说，今天他有一个特大好消息，要向大家公布。 但是他又不说是什么，只说我和我的“臭婊子”陈清扬今后的日子会很不好过。
column2: After a while, he said he had wonderful good news to announce later that day, but wouldn't reveal what it was except that "the rotten whore" Chen Qingyang and I were going to have a really hard time from now on.

column1: 我听了这话格外恼火，想把他就地掐死，又想听他说出是什么好消息以后再下手。
column2: Infuriated by what he said, I was tempted to choke him right on the spot, but my curiosity about the great news got the better of me.

column1: 他却不说，一直卖着关子，只说些没要紧的话，到了队里以后才说，晚上你来听会吧，会上我会宣布的。
column2: However, he went on talking nonsense to keep me guessing. Not until we reached our team did he say, Come to the meeting tonight. I'll announce the news at the meeting.

column1: 晚上我没去听会，在屋里收拾东西，准备逃上山去。
column2: But I didn't go to the meeting that evening. I packed my stuff, ready to flee back to the mountains.

column1: 我想一定发生了什么大事，以致军代表有了好办法来收拾我和陈清扬，至于是什么事我没想出来，那年头的事很难猜。
column2: I believed that some major event must have happened to give the military deputy a way to take care of Chen Qingyang and me. As for what the event was, I couldn't figure it out—in those days anything could happen.

column1: 我甚至想到可能中国已经复辟了帝制，军代表已经当上了此地的土司。
column2: I even imagined that the emperor had been restored and the military deputy had become the local chief.

column1: 他可以把我锤骟掉，再把陈清扬拉去当妃子。
column2: He could castrate me with a hammer and then take Chen Qingyang as his concubine.

column1: 等我收拾好要出门，才知道没有那么严重。
column2: By the time I finished my packing and was about to leave, I realized that things were not that bad.

column1: 因为会场上喊口号，我在屋里也能听见。
column2: People were shouting slogans at the meeting that I could hear even from my room.

column1: 原来是此地将从国营农场改做军垦兵团。 军代表可能要当个团长。
column2: It turned out that our state-run farm had been changed into an Army Production Corps, and the military deputy might be promoted to Regimental Commander.

column1: 不管怎么说，他不能把我阉掉，也不能把陈清扬拉走。
column2: At any rate, he couldn't castrate me, or take Chen Qingyang as his concubine.

column1: 我犹豫了几分钟，还是把装好的东西背上了肩，还用砍刀把屋里的一切都砍坏，并且用木炭在墙上写了：“XXX（军代表名），操你妈！”
column2: After a few minutes' hesitation, I slung the pack on my back. Then I hacked up everything in the place with a machete, found a piece of charcoal, and wrote "xxx (the military deputy's name), fuck your mother!" on the wall.

column1: 然后出了门，上山去了。
column2: After that I left and headed up the mountain.

column1: 我从十四队逃跑的事就是这样。
column2: That was how I ran away from the fourteenth team.

column1: 这些经过我也在交待材料里写了。
column2: I also included these things in my confessions.

column1: 概括地说，是这样的：我和军代表有私仇，这私仇有两个方面：
column2: To summarize, it went like this: The military deputy had a personal grudge against me, which was twofold.

column1: 一是我在慰问团面前说出了曾经被打晕的事，叫军代表很没面子；二是争风吃醋，所以他一直修理我。
column2: Firstly, I told the relief delegation that I had been beaten unconscious, which made the military deputy lose face; secondly, he and I fought over a woman, which was why he was always trying to screw me.

column1: 当他要当团长时，我感到不堪忍受，逃到山上去了。
column2: So, when I learned he was about to become Regimental Commander, I felt that I couldn't take it anymore and fled into the mountains.

column1: 我到现在还以为这是我逃上山的原因。
column2: Even today I still believe that was the true reason for my escape.

column1: 但是人家说，军代表根本就没当上团长，我逃跑的理由不能成立。
column2: But they said that the military deputy hadn't become Regimental Commander, so my explanation for running away wouldn't stand up.

column1: 所以人家说，这样的交待材料不可信。
column2: So, they said my confessions were unconvincing.

column1: 可信的材料应该是，我和陈清扬有私情。
column2: A convincing confession would be that Chen Qingyang and I were having a love affair.

column1: 俗话说，色胆包天，我们什么事都能干出来。 这话也有一点道理，可是我从队里逃出来时，原本不打算找陈清扬，打算一走算了。
column2: As the saying goes: For sex, a man would dare anything. We would do anything for it — well, there's some truth to that. But when I ran away from our team, I didn't plan to see Chen Qingyang, thinking that I could just leave without telling anyone.

column1: 走到山边上才想到，不管怎样，陈是我的一个朋友，该去告别。
column2: When I reached the edge of the mountains I realized that after all Chen Qingyang was a friend of mine and I should go back to say goodbye to her.

column1: 谁知陈清扬说，她要和我一起逃跑。
column2: I hadn't expected Chen Qingyang to say she wanted to run away with me.

column1: 她还说，假如这种事她不加入，那伟大友谊岂不是喂了狗。
column2: She said if she didn't join me in such an adventure, we would throw our great friendship to the dogs.

column1: 于是她匆匆忙忙收拾了一些东西跟我走了。
column2: So she packed some stuff in a hurry and took off with me.

column1: 假如没有她和她收拾的东西，我一定会病死在山上。
column2: Without her and what she packed, I would have gotten sick and died on the mountain for sure.

column1: 那些东西里有很多治疟疾的药，还有大量的大号避孕套。
column2: The supplies she packed included lots of malaria medicine, and plenty of jumbo-sized condoms.

column1: 我和陈清扬逃上山以后，农场很惊慌了一阵。
column2: After Chen Qingyang and I escaped to the mountains, the farm panicked for a while.

column1: 他们以为我们跑到缅甸去了。
column2: They believed we had run off to Burma.

column1: 这件事传出去对谁都没好处，所以就没向上报告，只是在农场内部通缉王二和陈清扬。
column2: It wouldn't have been good for any of us if that news had gotten out. So they didn't report us, only issued a wanted poster on the farm.

column1: 我们的样子很好认，还带了一条别人没有的双筒猎枪，很容易被人发现，可是一直没人找到我们。 直到半年后以后，我们自己回到农场来，各回各的队，又过了一个多月，才被人保组叫去写交待。
column2: Both Chen Qingyang and I were easily recognized, and, besides, the double-barreled shotgun we brought along was hard to hide. But for some reason nobody found us until half a year later when each of us returned to our own teams. And then after another month, the public security section summoned us to write our confessions.

column1: 也是我们流年不利，碰上了一个运动，被人揭发了出来。
column2: It was our bad luck to be the victims of a new political campaign and have someone inform on us.

column1: 人保组的房子在场部的路口上，是一座孤零零的土坯房。
column2: The office of public security was located at the entrance to our farm's headquarters. It was a lonely mud-brick house.
